inline.content: Monster Maker is a competative deck-building game for 2 - 4 players. Players play rival mad scientists each trying to build the most powerful army of monsters that they can.

content.text: Monster Maker is a competative deck-building game for 2 - 4 players. Players play rival mad scientists each trying to build the most powerful army of monsters that they can.

inline.content: Monster Maker is a deck-building game: means that each player starts with a small deck of the same cards and take turns acquiring cards from a shared pool of unique cards to each add to their own deck. In Monster Maker, the cards are the parts that the players will use to create their monsters. At the end of the game, each player will score the monsters that they are able to build from their deck. The player with the highest score wins.

content.text: Monster Maker is a deck-building game: means that each player starts with a small deck of the same cards and take turns acquiring cards from a shared pool of unique cards to each add to their own deck. In Monster Maker, the cards are the parts that the players will use to create their monsters. At the end of the game, each player will score the monsters that they are able to build from their deck. The player with the highest score wins.

inline.content: Each card is one of three types: Head, Torso, Feet. Each card type has a related stat: Brains, Brawn, Speed.

content.text: Each card is one of three types: Head, Torso, Feet. Each card type has a related stat: Brains, Brawn, Speed.

inline.content: ```This is a Head Card. This card is worth 2 Brains.```

content.text: This is a Head Card. This card is worth 2 Brains.

inline.content: ```This is a Torso Card. This card is worth 4 Brawn.```

content.text: This is a Torso Card. This card is worth 4 Brawn.

inline.content: ```This is a Feet Card. This card is worth 2 Speed.```

content.text: This is a Feet Card. This card is worth 2 Speed.

inline.content: Line of one of each of the three types of cards and you have a __Complete__ Monster.

content.text: Line of one of each of the three types of cards and you have a

inline.content: Line up two cards of (any) different types, and you have a __Partial__ Monster.

content.text: Line up two cards of (any) different types, and you have a

inline.content: To set up the game, separate and distribute the cards as follows:

content.text: To set up the game, separate and distribute the cards as follows:

inline.content: Each player is given a Laboratory card and a slider. This is an oversized card which is not played, but is instead used by the players to track their damage taken. Attach the slider to the highest point on the damage meter. Each Laboratory also has a special ability.

content.text: Each player is given a Laboratory card and a slider. This is an oversized card which is not played, but is instead used by the players to track their damage taken. Attach the slider to the highest point on the damage meter. Each Laboratory also has a special ability.

inline.content: Each player starts with a deck of 4 of each of the following cards:

content.text: Each player starts with a deck of 4 of each of the following cards:

inline.content: At the start of the game, each player will shuffle their deck and deal themselves a hand of 6 cards face up on the table.

content.text: At the start of the game, each player will shuffle their deck and deal themselves a hand of 6 cards face up on the table.

inline.content: There will be multiple copies of each of the following cards.

content.text: There will be multiple copies of each of the following cards.

inline.content: These are parts that are always available. Place each stack of these cards face up where all players can reach.

content.text: These are parts that are always available. Place each stack of these cards face up where all players can reach.

inline.content: Shuffle the remaining cards and place alongside the stacks of common cards. Flip up the top seven cards in a row between all the players. This is the Conveyer.

content.text: Shuffle the remaining cards and place alongside the stacks of common cards. Flip up the top seven cards in a row between all the players. This is the Conveyer.

inline.content: On your turn, you may use whatever cards you have in your hand to acquire cards from the center row, or, if you have one card of each type, you may create a monster and attack one of your opponent's. You may also use the special abilities of a card in your hand. Your turn ends when you have used or discarded all the cards from your hand and deal yourself a new hand of 6 cards. The next player begins their turn by scrapping (placing face up on the Scrap pile -- see above) the card on the Conveyer furthest from the center deck, sliding all of the Conveyer cards down one space, and drawing a new card from the center deck to add to the Conveyer. Once the center deck and the conveyer are empty, the game is over, and the players will score their decks (see Scoring below).

content.text: On your turn, you may use whatever cards you have in your hand to acquire cards from the center row, or, if you have one card of each type, you may create a monster and attack one of your opponent's. You may also use the special abilities of a card in your hand. Your turn ends when you have used or discarded all the cards from your hand and deal yourself a new hand of 6 cards. The next player begins their turn by scrapping (placing face up on the Scrap pile -- see above) the card on the Conveyer furthest from the center deck, sliding all of the Conveyer cards down one space, and drawing a new card from the center deck to add to the Conveyer. Once the center deck and the conveyer are empty, the game is over, and the players will score their decks (see Scoring below).

inline.content: The cards in your hand act as currency to acquire cards from the center row, but each type (Brains, Brawn, Speed) can only be used to acquire cards of the same type. Total up the points in your hand for each stat; you have that much to spend to acquire. When you have chosen which cards you wish to acquire, place both the cards you've acquired and the cards you've spent in your discard pile. For Example:

content.text: The cards in your hand act as currency to acquire cards from the center row, but each type (Brains, Brawn, Speed) can only be used to acquire cards of the same type. Total up the points in your hand for each stat; you have that much to spend to acquire. When you have chosen which cards you wish to acquire, place both the cards you've acquired and the cards you've spent in your discard pile. For Example:

inline.content: You have one brains cards in your hand worth 2 and there is a card worth 2 brains in the center row, you may acquire it.

content.text: You have one brains cards in your hand worth 2 and there is a card worth 2 brains in the center row, you may acquire it.

inline.content: You have two brains cards in your hand; one worth 2 and another worth 3, and there is a card worth 5 brains in the center row, you may acquire it.

content.text: You have two brains cards in your hand; one worth 2 and another worth 3, and there is a card worth 5 brains in the center row, you may acquire it.

inline.content: You have a brains card worth 7 in your hand and there are two brains cards in the center row, one worth 3 and one worth 4, you may acquire both of them.

content.text: You have a brains card worth 7 in your hand and there are two brains cards in the center row, one worth 3 and one worth 4, you may acquire both of them.

inline.content: If you are going to attack, you cannot use the cards you are using for your monster to also acquire. Separate out the cards for your monster and alert the opponent you wish to attack of your intent.

content.text: If you are going to attack, you cannot use the cards you are using for your monster to also acquire. Separate out the cards for your monster and alert the opponent you wish to attack of your intent.

inline.content: Your opponent then has the opportunity to defend. To defend, the defending player must create at least one partial monster and at most one complete or two partial monsters. If the defending player cannot do this, they must scrap two cards from their hand and take two damage on their Laboratory. If the defending player __chooses to not__ do this, they must scrap two cards from their hand and take three damage on their Laboratory.

content.text: Your opponent then has the opportunity to defend. To defend, the defending player must create at least one partial monster and at most one complete or two partial monsters. If the defending player cannot do this, they must scrap two cards from their hand and take two damage on their Laboratory. If the defending player
do this, they must scrap two cards from their hand and take three damage on their Laboratory.

inline.content: The Attacking monster (as with any complete monster) has three stats: Brains, Brawn, Speed. To successfully defend, the defending player's monster(s) must at least tie at least two of the three stats. If the defending player succeeds, the defending monster(s) are discarded. If not, the defending monster(s) are scrapped, and the player's Laboratory takes damage, one point if the defending player's monster(s) lose on two stats, two points if the defending player's monster(s) lose on three. (see Combat Examples below)

content.text: The Attacking monster (as with any complete monster) has three stats: Brains, Brawn, Speed. To successfully defend, the defending player's monster(s) must at least tie at least two of the three stats. If the defending player succeeds, the defending monster(s) are discarded. If not, the defending monster(s) are scrapped, and the player's Laboratory takes damage, one point if the defending player's monster(s) lose on two stats, two points if the defending player's monster(s) lose on three. (see Combat Examples below)

inline.content: Many of the cards have special abilities. These abilities are in the box next to the card's stat.

content.text: Many of the cards have special abilities. These abilities are in the box next to the card's stat.

content.text: To successfully defend, all you have to do is have at least two stats be at least equal to two of the attacker's stats.

content.text: As you can see, our defending monster has 4 Brains, 1 Brawn and 3 Speed.
